Helmholtz Laboratory for Tectonic Modelling (GFZ German Research Centre for Geosciences, Germany);GFZ German Research Centre for Geosciences, Potsdam, Germany;en;10.1016/j.tecto.2016.02.036;10.1190/INT-2016-0063.1;10.1016/j.gloplacha.2017.11.002;10.1016/j.tecto.2016.01.017;10.1002/2016JB012915;10.1016/j.jsg.2015.03.008;10.1002/ceat.200303112;https://www.springer.com/de/book/9783540737674;2237044 Bytes;3 Files;application/octet-stream;application/pdf;application/pdf;1;CC BY 4.0;This dataset provides internal and basal (wall) friction data from ring-shear tests (RST) on a quartz sand material that has been used in tectonic experiments in Zwaan et al. (2016, 2017), Zwaan and Scheurs (2017) and in the Tectonic Modelling Lab of the University of Bern (CH) as an analogue for brittle layers in the crust or lithosphere. The material has been characterized by means of internal and basal friction coefficients μ and cohesions C as a remote service by the Helmholtz Laboratory for Tectonic Modelling (HelTec) at the GFZ German Research Centre for Geosciences in Potsdam for the Tectonic Modelling Lab of the University of Bern (UB).
